instructions: Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Mobile network > Advanced > Access Point Names . Tap Plus icon to add a new APN. The default APN is named 'T-Mobile US' and has these settings: Name: T-Mobile APN: fast.t-mobile.com Proxy: [Not set] Port: [Not set] Username: [Not set] Password: [Not set] Server: [Not set] MMSC: http://mms.msg.eng.t-mobile.com/mms/wapenc MMS proxy: [Not set] MMS port: [Not set] MCC: 310 MNC: 260 Authentication type: [Not set] APN type: default,supl,hipri,fota,mms APN protocol: IPv6 APN roaming protocol: IPv4 APN enable/disable: Enabled MVNO type: None MVNO value: [Not set]

Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Mobile network > Advanced . Tap the switch next to Automatically select network to turn it off. The device will search for available networks. When it finishes, tap the desired network.

Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Mobile network > Advanced . Tap Preferred network type and choose from the following options: LTE on (Automatic LTE/3G/2G) LTE/3G 2G Only
Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Advanced . Tap the switch next to Airplane mode to turn on or off.
Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Mobile network . Tap the switch next to Roaming to turn data roaming on or off.
Swipe up on the Home screen to view your apps, then tap Settings . Tap Network & Internet > Mobile network . Tap the switch next to Mobile data to turn on or off.
